Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Creation of TOC not working anymore after moving to release 2.20" (#1544) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
We are facing the issue after moving away from OpenXML 2.75 to the new release stream 2.20. The call OpenXmlReader.Create(mySW.BaseStream) converting a stream into an OpenXMLElement is not anymore possible and compiling is resulting into an ERROR. Do you have an alternative solution to insert a TOC. It's was working very well up to now.
```vb
            Dim myOpenXMLElement As OpenXmlElement
            Dim xmlString As XElement = <w:sdt xmlns:w='http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main'>
                                            <w:sdtPr>
                                                <w:docPartObj>
                                                    <w:docPartGallery w:val='Table of Contents'/>
                                                    <w:docPartUnique/>
                                                </w:docPartObj>
                                            </w:sdtPr>
                                            <w:sdtEndPr>
                                                <w:rPr>
                                                    <w:rFonts w:asciiTheme='minorHAnsi' w:cstheme='minorBidi' w:eastAsiaTheme='minorHAnsi' w:hAnsiTheme='minorHAnsi'/>
                                                    <w:color w:val='auto'/>
                                                    <w:sz w:val='22'/>
                                                    <w:szCs w:val='22'/>
                                                    <w:lang w:eastAsia='en-US'/>
                                                </w:rPr>
                                            </w:sdtEndPr>
                                            <w:sdtContent>
                                                <w:p>
                                                    <w:pPr>
                                                        <w:pStyle w:val='ptHeading1'/>
                                                    </w:pPr>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:t>Table of Content</w:t>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                </w:p>
                                                <w:p>
                                                    <w:pPr>
                                                        <w:pStyle w:val='TOC1'/>
                                                        <w:tabs>
                                                            <w:tab w:val='right' w:leader='dot' w:pos='9350'/>
                                                        </w:tabs>
                                                        <w:rPr>
                                                            <w:noProof/>
                                                        </w:rPr>
                                                    </w:pPr>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:fldChar w:fldCharType='begin' w:dirty='true'/>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:instrText xml:space='preserve'> TOC \o "1-<%= myTocLevel %>" \h \ u </w:instrText>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:fldChar w:fldCharType='separate' w:dirty='true'/>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                </w:p>
                                                <w:p>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:rPr>
                                                            <w:b/>
                                                            <w:bCs/>
                                                            <w:noProof/>
                                                        </w:rPr>
                                                        <w:fldChar w:fldCharType='end' w:dirty='true'/>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                </w:p>
                                            </w:sdtContent>
                                        </w:sdt>
            Try
                Using mySW As New StreamWriter(New MemoryStream)
                    mySW.Write(xmlString.ToString)
                    mySW.Flush()
                    mySW.BaseStream.Seek(0, SeekOrigin.Begin)
                    Dim myOpenXMLReader As OpenXmlReader = **OpenXmlReader.Create(mySW.BaseStream)**
                    myOpenXMLReader.Read()
                    myOpenXMLElement = myOpenXMLReader.LoadCurrentElement
                    myOpenXMLReader.Close()
                End Using
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Creation of TOC not working anymore after moving to release 2.20" (#1544) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
We are facing the issue after moving away from OpenXML 2.75 to the new release stream 2.20. The call OpenXmlReader.Create(mySW.BaseStream) converting a stream into an OpenXMLElement is not anymore possible and compiling is resulting into an ERROR. Do you have an alternative solution to insert a TOC. It's was working very well up to now.

            Dim myOpenXMLElement As OpenXmlElement
            Dim xmlString As XElement = <w:sdt xmlns:w='http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main'>
                                            <w:sdtPr>
                                                <w:docPartObj>
                                                    <w:docPartGallery w:val='Table of Contents'/>
                                                    <w:docPartUnique/>
                                                </w:docPartObj>
                                            </w:sdtPr>
                                            <w:sdtEndPr>
                                                <w:rPr>
                                                    <w:rFonts w:asciiTheme='minorHAnsi' w:cstheme='minorBidi' w:eastAsiaTheme='minorHAnsi' w:hAnsiTheme='minorHAnsi'/>
                                                    <w:color w:val='auto'/>
                                                    <w:sz w:val='22'/>
                                                    <w:szCs w:val='22'/>
                                                    <w:lang w:eastAsia='en-US'/>
                                                </w:rPr>
                                            </w:sdtEndPr>
                                            <w:sdtContent>
                                                <w:p>
                                                    <w:pPr>
                                                        <w:pStyle w:val='ptHeading1'/>
                                                    </w:pPr>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:t>Table of Content</w:t>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                </w:p>
                                                <w:p>
                                                    <w:pPr>
                                                        <w:pStyle w:val='TOC1'/>
                                                        <w:tabs>
                                                            <w:tab w:val='right' w:leader='dot' w:pos='9350'/>
                                                        </w:tabs>
                                                        <w:rPr>
                                                            <w:noProof/>
                                                        </w:rPr>
                                                    </w:pPr>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:fldChar w:fldCharType='begin' w:dirty='true'/>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:instrText xml:space='preserve'> TOC \o "1-<%= myTocLevel %>" \h \ u </w:instrText>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:fldChar w:fldCharType='separate' w:dirty='true'/>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                </w:p>
                                                <w:p>
                                                    <w:r>
                                                        <w:rPr>
                                                            <w:b/>
                                                            <w:bCs/>
                                                            <w:noProof/>
                                                        </w:rPr>
                                                        <w:fldChar w:fldCharType='end' w:dirty='true'/>
                                                    </w:r>
                                                </w:p>
                                            </w:sdtContent>
                                        </w:sdt>
            Try
                Using mySW As New StreamWriter(New MemoryStream)
                    mySW.Write(xmlString.ToString)
                    mySW.Flush()
                    mySW.BaseStream.Seek(0, SeekOrigin.Begin)
                    Dim myOpenXMLReader As OpenXmlReader = **OpenXmlReader.Create(mySW.BaseStream)**
                    myOpenXMLReader.Read()
                    myOpenXMLElement = myOpenXMLReader.LoadCurrentElement
                    myOpenXMLReader.Close()
                End Using

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Get Current Page n" (#1515) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Closed issue "Is Storm-0978/CVE-2023-36884 affecting this library?" (#1494) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
On our project we're using `DocumentFormat.OpenXml` to convert OOXML documents to HTML (`WmlToHtmlConverter.ConvertToHtml(WordprocessingDocument, WmlToHtmlConverterSettings)`). Given the newly found [CVE-2023-36884 vulnerability](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2023/07/11/storm-0978-attacks-reveal-financial-and-espionage-motives/) we've been trying to figure out if this library is affected by it. However, I can't seem to find details about how macros and remote content (altChunk) is loaded (if at all). Can you tell us if we need to take any precautions or if this library is safe from this vulnerability?

**Server (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows
 - .NET Target:.NET Framework 4.7.2
 - DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.20.0

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CT_PresetTextShape's prstTxWarp gets PresetTextWrap wrapper class" (#1447) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
This is a typo on the backend generator. The class name should match more closely the element name prstTxWarp.

**Observed behavior**
In  the generated file: 
Open-XML-SDK\generated\DocumentFormat.OpenXml\DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Generator\DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Generator.OpenXmlGenerator\schemas_openxmlformats_org_drawingml_2006_main.cs

The class is defined: 
public partial class PresetTextWrap : OpenXmlCompositeElement

**Expected behavior**
public partial class PresetTextWarp : OpenXmlCompositeElement

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bug with Open XML SDK" (#1513) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
OpenXml.Packaging.WordProcessingDoucment.Open throws "Specified part does not exist in the package." not found even when all parts are present in the docx.
This seems to only happen when the docx has diagrams part in it and has a relationship specified in data.xml.rels. Specified relationship is as follows: "<Relationship Id="rId1" Type="http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/2007/relationships/diagramDrawing" Target="diagrams/drawing1.xml" />".
Removing the relationship seems to be able to open the document document but the relationship is a valid relation.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**To Reproduce**
Try to open any document having diagrams component in it and see the issue happening.

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Use any document as file which contains drawing component in it.
Try to do OpenXml.Packaging.WordProcessingDoucment.Open
Observe that method throws Specified part not found in package exception even though all parts are present in the docx.

**Observed behavior**
Open method should not be throwing any exception.

**Expected behavior**
Document should open without any exceptions being thrown.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: MacOs Ventura 13.2.1
 - Office version 
 - .NET Target: .NET 6.0
 - DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.20.0

**Additional context**
NA

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add builder infrastructure to streamline package creation" (#1474) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This is a work in progress to explore a pipeline of sorts to create packages. Main benefits of this are:

- Middleware style pipeline to abstract away things required to do to initialize a package
- Can simplify the creation of templates from any source (not fully working atm)
- Enable Clone() functionality to initialize packages in identical ways
- Provide special builders for more AOT-friendly scenarios
  - For example, packages currently have all parts registered to them. Using these builders, we can track what are the required parts and use that to create specialized builders (see `DebugPackageBuilderExtensions` as an example)

For now, it will remain internal, but hopefully for v3.1 can be made public with some support to better enable AOT scenarios.
